result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Surety
Copy of warrant sent to DA and Sheriff.

Attorney Nadya E Perez-Reyes in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Perez Reyes appears for Atty. DeJunco. Letter was mailed to defendant by defense counsel, not sure if defendant received this letter yet. Court orders bench warrant issued. Bail forfeited.

Atty. Patti Wabitsch appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Wilfred DeJunco in court for the defendant who was not present. Atty. DeJunco stated he does not know why defendant is not in court. Court adjourns case to 10:00 am calendar to allow defendant to appear. Case recalled at 10:00 am. Atty. Jeff Sisley appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Nadia Perez Reyes appears for defendant, not present. Atty. Perez Reyes states Atty. DeJunco could not reach the defendant by phone. Court orders bench warrant but stays it until 4/30/2015 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 28, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Court interpreter Vicki Bermudez in Court. Defendant Elmer A Viega in court with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. DeJunco has received an offer from the State, needs an assessment completed before disposition.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Elmer A Viega in court with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter John Vaughn in person.  Counsel requesting adj, trying to resolve with DA Gerol.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 17, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Spanish interpreter John Vaughn present in court. Defendant Elmer A Viega in court with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is informed the next court date will be a disposition, Atty. DeJunco needs to complete pretrial with the State.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 20, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco in court.  Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. DeJunco informs the court the defendant had one cast removed, still in a wheelchair. Atty. DeJunco requests another date for possible disposition, defendant may not realize he needs to appear in court today. Court orders a bench warrant but stays until 1/20/2015.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Further proceedings on December 16, 2014 at 08:00 am.

Court interpreter John Vaughn present in court. Defendant Elmer A Viega in court with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is informed as to defendant's current medical condition.  Further proceedings scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 08:00 am.
Further proceedings on November 18, 2014 at 08:00 am.

Court interpreter John Vaughn present in court. Defendant Elmer A Viega in court with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. DeJunco requests an additional 30 days to have pretrial with the State.  Further proceedings scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 08:00 am. Condition of bail to continue without scram bracelet.
Further proceedings on October 21, 2014 at 08:00 am.

Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco in court.  Adam Y. Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. DeJunco informs the Court defendant is currently bedridden with surgery tomorrow.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Elmer A Viega in court by phone with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is informed defendant has broken his legs and cannot have scram bracelet at this time. Court amends bail conditions removing requirement of scram bracelet being installed. Atty. DeJunco spoke with defendant in spanish.  Case will remain on the calendar on 9/16/2014.
14R 010703 - Includes 2013CM207
Further proceedings on September 16, 2014 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Elmer A Viega in court with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Defendant in custody. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter John Vaughn present.  Defense waives reading of the information and/or complaint and enters a plea of not guilty.  Further proceedings scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 08:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Further proceedings on August 19, 2014 at 08:00 am.

Clerk contacted Atty. DeJunco to determine if case is to be heard before Branch 3 or Branch 1. Assignment prepared to forward this case to Branch 1 for interpreter court. Case removed from Branch 3 calendar on 8/18/2014 and rescheduled to 8:00 am on 8/19/2014 before Branch 1.

Further proceedings on August 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Elmer A Villeda in court with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jon Vaughn, spanish interpreter in court to interpret.  Statements by parties.  Court denies Atty. DeJunco's request.  Deputy Scott Heller sworn and testified.  Court finds probable cause and binds matter over.  Information filed.  Defendant waived reading of information. Plea of not guilty entered.  Matter set before Judge Williams at this time but may transfer to Br. 1 with interpreter court.  Jon Vaughn interpeter available on August 18th date.  If matter to transfer to Br. 1 Atty. DeJunco to notify court in order to cancel interpreter.  Further proceedings scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Clerk e-mailed DA's office and Atty. DeJunco that court granted the extension.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Strike Prior Conviction,   Scanned and forwarded to Br. 2
From the State to the Court -  Scanned and forwarded to Br. 3.
Preliminary hearing on July 9, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Elmer A Villeda in court with attorney Wilfred P de Junco.  Defendant in custody. Patti L Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Vickie Bermudez appears and is sworn. Motion has been filed by defense. Counsel waives timelimits for preliminary hearing. Motion is of legal nature not evidentiary, parties to submit written response/reply to motion.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 09:30 am.
To Strike Prior Conviction -   Scanned and forwarded to Br. 3.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: State by ADA Jeffrey Sisley.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Alme Boaz.  Counsel advises Atty Dejunco will be representing the defendant.  Counsel advises the defendant is in need of a spanish interpreter.  State requesting $7500 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders matter adj to 6/4 at 8:30 am for initial appr.   Counsel advises the defendant was in Racine County Jail for the past 7 months.  Court sets bail at $1500 cash bail w/conditions:  absolute sobriety; not to operate m/v w/out valid dl; SCRAM Bracelet by 4 pm on day of posting bail.  Counsel requesting a brief adj for status of prelim hrg.  Court orders this case transferred to Branch 3.
Per Dispatch, subject is in custody on warrant
Warrant e-mailed to Sheriff's department.
